fields.summary: hdfs snapshotDiff /.reserved/raw/... fails on snapshottable directories

|| Subsystem || Report/Notes ||
| JIRA Issue | HDFS-11481 |
| JIRA Patch URL | https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12855504/HDFS-11481.patch.1 |

| Powered by | Apache Yetus 0.5.0-SNAPSHOT   http://yetus.apache.org |


This message was automatically generated.

Since many methods changed inside org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSDirectory had a large refactor between 2.6 to 3.0, I wrote my own helper functions for convenience when merging with trunk.  This makes rolling patch to hadoop 2.6 more simple.  We can clean up and use shared method in a separate jira that won't be rolled back to 2.6 versions.

Hi Mavin, thanks for filing this issue and submitting a patch!

Have you looked at fixing this on the server-side? /.reserved/raw is a server-side construct, so it makes more sense to handle it there. Generally, we pass the paths through to the NameNode as directly as possible besides qualification. Since both /.reserved/raw and .snapshot are "special" directories, our path munging might not support both.

Please also [name your patches according to the wiki|https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/HowToContribute#Naming_your_patch] so precommit can pick it up correctly.
Thanks [~andrew.wang], I have taken your suggestions and applied a first revision patch.
Added custom patch to 2.6.0 since trunk is no longer backwards compatible with that version.

Hi [~andrew.wang], regarding HDFS-11481.002.patch.  I checked the logs and junit should be passing all tests.  The failures were timeout failures independent to my contribution.  Also, since trunk can't be merged back to 2.6.0, should I be creating a separate patch for branch-2.6.0? or would I contribute to branch-2 in any way?  Thanks!

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

Thanks [~mavinmartin@gmail.com] for working on this issue and [~andrew.wang] for the review.

Hi [~jingzhao],

Would you please help answering Andrew's question in his comments above:

[~jingzhao] is this the right direction? Not sure why these methods don't use {{resolvePath}}.

Thanks a lot.

Hi [~mavinmartin@gmail.com],

Thanks for your earlier work. The patch doesn't apply in trunk, wonder if you could produce a new rev and we can review from there?

Thanks.

Hi [~mavinmartin@gmail.com],

I did some study. Would you please share:
 # which release you observed the issue reported here?
 # Did you verify that the patch you created solve the problem reported here (snapshotDiff on /.reserved/raw)?

The reason I was asking is, the change you did in the patch here simply to allow setSnapshot to take /.reserved/raw kind of path, but it did not seem to do anything with snapshotDiff. I suspect the issue is fixed by HDFS-10997 but yet to find out.  Seems to me that resolvePath might be the way to go.

Thanks.

--Yongjun

Hi [~yzhangal],

Thank you for reviewing this!  We are in the process of verifying the validity of this patch and will provide an update next week.

Thanks!

Mavin

Thanks [~mavinmartin@gmail.com].

Would you please share what release you are running? and does it have HDFS-10997?
Hi, [~yzhangal], the relevant release is CDH 5.5.1. Unfortunately, I don't see HDFS-10997 merged into any Cloudera Hadoop version.

HI [~axenol],

Thanks for the update. We are working on a solution for that.

As an assisting step, I created HDFS-13315 to add a test to verify that the issue is fixed by HDFS-10997.
Thank you, [~yzhangal]. I added myself as a watcher.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #13863 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/13863/])
HDFS-13315. Add a test for the issue reported in HDFS-11481 which is (yzhang: rev 6c63cc7d304571578e6551170552182d30b8e8fa)
* (edit) hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/TestEncryptionZones.java

* (edit) hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/namenode/snapshot/TestSnapshotDiffReport.java
Should this be resolved?
